trans-unit.source: Contains instance information about a single instance of a <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBindingExpression> describes a single run-time instance of a <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding>.
Therefore, it describes a collection of <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingExpression> objects attached to a single binding target property.
For information about binding expressions, see the Binding and BindingExpression section in the [Data Binding Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/data/data-binding-overview.md).

With the use of a converter, the property values of the <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingExpression> objects in a <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBindingExpression> produce a final value for the target property.
In the reverse direction, the target property value is translated to a set of values that are fed back into the <xref:System.Windows.Data.BindingExpression> objects.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding>.
Gets the collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpression"></xref> objects in this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBindingExpression"></xref>.
A read-only collection of the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpression"></xref> objects.

Even though the return type is a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpressionBase"></xref> objects the returned collection would only contain <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingExpression"></xref> objects because the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding"></xref> class currently only supports <xref href="System.Windows.Data.Binding"></xref> objects.

Returns a value that indicates whether any of the inner <xref href="System.Windows.Data.Binding"></xref> objects or the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding"></xref> itself has a failing validation rule.

You can set validation rules on both the <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding> object and the individual <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding> objects in the <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding> object.

The binding engine evaluates the <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding.ValidationRules%2A> on the <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding> object when a value moves from the binding target property to the <xref:System.Windows.Data.IMultiValueConverter> object (multi-value converter).

After that, when a value moves from the converter to the binding source property of an individual binding, the binding engine evaluates the <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding.ValidationRules%2A> on that <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding> object.

`true` if at least one of the inner <xref href="System.Windows.Data.Binding"></xref> objects or the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding"></xref> itself has a failing validation rule; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the parent binding has a failed validation rule.
This property is identical to the <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBindingExpression.HasError%2A> property.
`true` if the parent binding has a failed validation rule; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding"></xref> object from which this <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBindingExpression"></xref> is created.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding"></xref> object from which this <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBindingExpression"></xref> is created.

Sends the current binding target value to the binding source properties in <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingMode.TwoWay"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Data.BindingMode.OneWayToSource"></xref> bindings.
Forces a data transfer from the binding source properties to the binding target property.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationError"></xref> object that caused this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBindingExpression"></xref> to be invalid.

You can set validation rules on both the <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding> object and the individual <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding> objects in the <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding> object.

The binding engine evaluates the <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding.ValidationRules%2A> on the <xref:System.Windows.Data.MultiBinding> object when a value moves from the binding target property to the <xref:System.Windows.Data.IMultiValueConverter> object (multi-value converter).

After that, when a value moves from the converter to the binding source property of an individual binding, the binding engine evaluates the <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding.ValidationRules%2A> on that <xref:System.Windows.Data.Binding> object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ValidationError"></xref> object that caused this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Data.MultiBindingExpression"></xref> to be invalid.
